column1: #Text=DS : Would you say it comes from emotion and character ?
#Text=EB : Yeah -- how well you can convey to the audience your point of view .
#Text=You could be living in a box , but if you can really convey it well then it makes for exciting reading .
#Text=But , you know , you have to be Proust to do that .
#Text=DS : Do you draw any inspiration from the current political climate , either in the country or in the world ?
#Text=EB : Politically , I 'm an activist , but my work is always about sort of the attitude that underlies it all .
#Text=It feels topical , but it is n't .
#Text=I mean , Talk Radio kind of surprised people , because they revived it last year , twenty years after it had been written , and it felt fresh .
#Text=But that 's because I do n't really write about topical stuff ; I write about American attitudes , American values , my values , my attitudes .
#Text=And to the degree that anybody sees things the way I see things , they can relate .
#Text=But I 'm not going to set out and say , " Okay , now what can I write about George Bush today ?
